results.title: Kokoda: the bloody track
results.creator_credit: Patrick Lindsay Productions, Australia. Army, Patrick Lindsay and George Friend
results.brief_description: This is a compelling and moving documentary about the Kokoda campaign in New Guinea during World War II from the perspectives of Australian and Japanese soldiers who fought at that time. Soldiers from both sides of the campaign described it as “an intensly personal war”, involving man to man fighting. The rugged and hostile terrain contributed to heavy losses and casualties, and the bravery of the indigenous stretcher bearers, nicknamed the “Fuzzy Wuzzy Angels”, saved the lives of many Australian soldiers. Features actual footage of the campaign and includes interviews with Australian and Japanese veterans.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Patrick Lindsay Productions, Australia. Army, Patrick Lindsay and George Friend

results.title: Kokoda front line; Herald newsreel
results.brief_description: Two programmes showing historical newsreel footage. 1. “Kokoda front line”. An edition of the weekly news magazine produced by Cinesound consisting of one full-reel coverage by Damien Parer of the war in New Guinea. Winner of an Academy award in 1942. 2. “The Herald newsreel”. One of the first sound films produced in Australia, this newsreel shows Joe Lyons, Primer Minister 1931-1939, and his Cabinet.

results.title: Kokoda front line!
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cinesound Review”.
An edition of the weekly news magazine (No. 568) produced by Cinesound in Sydney. This edition consists of one ‘fullreel’ item - “Kokoda Front Line” - by Damien Parer about the war in New Guinea. Includes a discussion on jungle warfare and the servicing of Australian troops on the front line. Winner of an Academy Award in 1942. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Koko Pops: Koko's history of music
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Robin Hughes, Don Ezard and Antoinette Starkiewicz
results.brief_description: A brief and bright animated history of music. Divided into brief vignettes, each with colourful characters dancing and/or playing music, it absorbs the viewer in a mixture of musical styles including primitive, pan flutes, Baroque, romantic, circus music, jazz, French popular, opera and variations of modern music.

results.title: KOK 28mm hand cranked projector
results.brief_description: In 1912, the popular Pathé Kok camera and projector arrived, which used the more standard 28mm film and cast a 30-inch picture.
results.description:
28mm hand crank projector designed by Pathe. Designed for home use, the Pathe KOK projector uses non-flammable cellulose acetate safety film and an electric light. The projector is powered by a crank handle. Contains: projector, hand crank, metal cover, 2 x metal reels.
Sticker on reel says “The property of Visual Education Centre, Education Dept. Victoria”
See video of same model (modified) of projector in use: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SG9Nvly1UB4
Was ACMI Lending Collection/ACMI Collection in 2014 audit - NR says unclear, but should keep.
28 mm gauge metal projector on wooden base.Object functions.

results.title: Kojak. Vol. 01
results.brief_description: A sink full of bloodied knives and the bodies of two young girls are found. Based on a true story, this movie length pilot has Theo, “I aint rich but at least I dress well”, detective Kojak in charge as the largest man hunt in New York ensues. A simple black boy is arrested and charged. It appears though that the confession was forced, the integrity of the commended and respected policemen in question. A court struggle drags on as Kojak sets out to discover the real murderer. Drugs, grime, poverty and hard hitting detective work spice up this television police drama. Telly Savalas plays the strong and masculine Kojak who shows his sensitive side, as all good policemen do.

results.title: Kodak Movie Light and two bulbs
results.brief_description: “Kodak Movie light 220 x 140V 1000W V/XS/200 label on reverse says: do not earth. double insulation. On and Off switch: 250V A.C. only. ELMACO Australian plug: Peaston, 250V 7.5A V/A50/1 Two - Philips Photolita bulbs in their original boxes. Photolita* trademark PF218E 43 Photolita - NM 250V 500W C8 Made in Holland With one instruction pamphlet which has guide numbers of the exposure times.”
